name: Adriana Perez
review: The church is nice but it looks more interesting from the outside than it actually is.  The structure is beautiful but it isn't an impressive church by any means.  It is nice to admire some of the relics and religious artifacts inside (especially the organ), however, it lacks detail.  It was just ok. Free admission, $5 suggested donation

name: F Ainsa
review: Beautiful church and friendly congregation giving tours and explaining the history of their building. Gorgeous and full of symbolism.

name: Brooke Tiano
review:
This church is historical, breath-taking and the people that serve her are a joy to be around. We had the honor of getting married here and it was a dream come true. Rev. Joe Albright and Robbie Boggs are amazing people. The whole wedding process went so smooth and we will hold this church in our hearts forever. We truly felt connected to god here and feel so blessed that we were able to marry in this treasure of a church. If you have a chance to attend a service or tour here, please do not miss out on visiting.
Warmest Thanks and God Bless from the Rasumoff's
10.8.22

name: Melania Atzori
review: One of Flaglers most beautiful churches. The architecture is stunning. A must see when visiting historic downtown Saint Augustine

name: David
review: A beautiful church built by Henry Flagler in honor of his daughter, it's definitely worth a visit. The guides are knowledgeable and while the self-guided tour is free, I recommend donating a few dollars to help pay for renovations. Flagler, his wife and daughter and also buried here.

name: James
review: Beautiful!  The history is awesome.  There was a very helpful lady inside to answer questions.  The grounds are beautiful as well.

name: William King
review: Historic church in downtown St. Augustine.  Built by Henry Flagler to honor his daughter. He, his wife, and daughter are buried there.

name: Jay Montgomery
review: This building is gorgeous and so rich in history. The two Docents we're incredible, knowledgeable, and just good people.

name: Amaranth Sander
review: Absolutely beautiful architecture as well as stained glass. Lots of good historical information about the Flagler family on the self guided tour.

name: Greg Thompson
review: Beautiful church.  Lots of history.

name: Timothy Fuller
review: Beautiful church. Was built in under 400 days.

name: Tonya Anderton
review: The Sew and Sow ladies are making Big things happen by Putting Prayers to Action. If you are looking for a new place to fellowship and give back here it is!

name: Emily Walczak
review: I have been going to this church since I was born. Every single person there loves you from the inside out. They have beautiful hymnals, and sometimes the Children's Choir does performances. If you want to go to an amazing church this is the place to go.‚ù§Ô∏è There is also a garden that winds round the church, giving you a scenic walk. If you are planning a visit to St. Augustine, try to squeeze in a visit. It will definitely be worth it.

name: Edward Cotton
review: If u love old European style buildings this is the place.

name: Fanda Thomas
review: Beautiful church!  A must see on the trolley tour stop or if your on your own.

name: Rving Mojo's
review: Only got to see it at night. Beautifully lite church and grounds.

name: Ohio Fourth and Fifth Grade Science
review: The final resting place of Henry M. Flagler, one-time Bellevue, Ohio resident.

name: ToxicLagoon ‚ÄúToxicLagoon‚Äù
review: This church is amazingly beautiful and will take your breath away. It‚Äôs something you should see at least once in your life; you won‚Äôt be disappointed. The people there are incredibly friendly and willing to answer any questions you have, but if you prefer to tour on your own, that option is open to you as well. I loved it here, and I hope future visitors will love it as well.

name: Karen
review: A historic church that is absolutely beautiful, this place needs to be on your must see list. One of the top ten most beautiful  churches in the world, with really knowledgeable tour guides. 5000 pipe organ, and amazing stained glass windows are just the beginning. Don't skip visiting here!

name: Gina Malm
review: Just breathtaking!  Beautiful self-guided tour on Saturday morn.

name: Amy Watkins
review: This chuch is beautiful!  We took a tour through  and we will definitely go back when we go back!  I was stunned at how beautiful this church was I came home and told my mom i want to take my mom and step-dad with us it was just so pretty from far and the outside and when you  go inside theres sp many more  rooms and the stained glass was just wonderful!

name: Tom Lemcool
review: Sorry they are only open on Saturday for a few hours and for Sunday service. We wanted to visit but we're not here on those days. We have to think the Covid excuse is getting very old, since everything else in town is open.

name: Mary Bradshaw Duncan
review: For love of a daughter we have a father to thank for this beautiful church in St. Augustine. Ask any question you can think of to those inside. Delicate Christmas ornaments are on sale and even a cookbook for Christmas gifts for loved ones and yourself. Say a prayer while you are there enjoying the beauty built for the love of a daughter.

name: rodney toy
review: This place is architecturally stunning.

name: Timothy Keller
review: I can't speak to the church service, but I came here over the weekend with a friend to explore some of St. Augustine history and this was our first stop. Beautiful architecture and quick informative tour and free booklet offered a detailed history of the church and its founding family.

name: L BG (Laura)
review: Beautiful architecture. Did not go inside. Just sightseeing in this beautiful town.

name: Jack Edwards
review: My wife and stopped here and were simply amazed!!!  The architecture of this building is phenomenal.  We were given a history of the building from a very pleasant woman and she was very informative.  Well worth the time to tour!!!!

name: Will English
review: Dr. Camp is an amazing orator and pastor. The church is very visually impressive as a historic monument in St. Augustine. I do have to complain about the Organist. He or she consistently plays at a deafening volume and more often than not, double the prescribed time for the song. Silent night, the peak of the Christmas Eve candlelight service, is rendered unenjoyable by the rendition played here. Other than the music, beautiful service.

name: Debe Gantt
review: The church is absolutely beautiful.  The stained glass windows are amazing.  Bill was the volunteer for the day.  He was very gracious and loaded with hospitality.

name: Robert
review: Very beautiful church. I just toured the place so I do not have in-depth information. Again very impressive. Down town, not hard to find, I suggest using a city garage for parking.

name: Ashley
review: What an absolute beautiful church. It‚Äôs stunning! The history behind it is amazing to hear, the detail is just unreal. Every time I come to St. Augustine, I visit this church.

name: Matt Law
review: Amazing building!

name: John Riddick
review: Awesome and interesting but its a functioning church so be prepared to be respectful

name: Cassandra G
review: Every time my husband and I walked past this church when visiting St. Augustine, we thought it was a Catholic Cathedral. The copper dome and spires are architecturally beautiful, and so we decided to explore one day and realized it was a Presbyterian church with a massively impressive pipe organ that seemed to overtake the room. Much to our surprise, the docent on duty informed us that Henry Flagler's mausoleum was located on the premises. Wandering over to the direction in which she pointed, we came to a gated entrance to a white room under a stained glass dome with four crypts: Henry's, two wives (one shared with a passed child), and an empty one.  There was something inspiring, and yet disturbing, to be viewing where Henry Flagler was laid to rest. If you are a history or architecture buff, I recommend stopping in.

name: Stan Kaszok
review: Very very beautiful place. Top 5 church in our great country. I loved the one in New Orleans,but just a special

name: steffyuwu
review: Great tip, really felt like god touched me from inside! Amen and praise god lol

name: Jim Bailey
review: This is so beautiful. We went to one of the Sundays service and it was fantastic. Everyone at the service was so friendly. Great service and was very impressed. Be sure to bring your camera.

name: Kathleen O'Connor
review: Clerk Paula keeps texting ex husband and claims a mistake - big difference in area codes and name. Does William want to know about this? It's happened nearly a dozen times this year. Terry how's the blue buddah. We have the phone records to prove this!  Also Terry were the Margueritas worth it last text received?  The phone belongs to me and I obviously see the records. Lose the phone number and contact information already!

name: Matthew Hanagan
review: Beautiful church. Can't wait to see the inside sometime.

name: Donna Francis
review: Liked the architecture, didn't get to actually go inside as there was a wedding at the time. Reviewed pictures.

name: Taylor Hodges
review: Beautiful and most elaborate church to tour in St. Augustine. The organist even played for us. Tours end at 3:30.

name: Casey Krout
review: Great place to visit

name: Cathy Stenger
review: I really enjoyed this stunning church that displayed so much of St Augustine's history.

name: Larry Lozen
review: One of two churches we explored,  both gorgeous and worth anyone's time

name: Debbie Lavoie
review: I loved the color and stained glass everywhere the ladies were so nice the work amazing

name: Nita Gerson
review: Beautiful, Amazing church! I LOVE to tour when visiting St. Augustine!

name: Fran Slezak
review: Very friendly informative staff. Beautiful building . Entrance by donation. Well worth going to.

name: Linda Kerr
review: This is a must visit in St. Augustine. So much history.  Beautiful church.

name: Heidi Lambert-Payton
review: Beautiful church.  Definitely recommend seeing while visiting St Augustine!

name: N V
review: This is my favorite place in St. Augustine. Jaw dropping, be sure to visit around Christmas to see the beautiful tree.

name: McKenna Charmaine Anderson
review: One of the most beautiful  cathedrals I have ever seen.

name: Ed ‚Äúed‚Äù Sipes
review: This is one of the most beautiful buildings I've ever seen.

name: Lon Martin
review: Beautiful historical architecture in St Augustine!

name: Ally Walczak
review: I have been baptized here and have been welcomed into this friendly community since birth. The church family here is wonderful.

name: Anita Ives
review: It's an honor each year to go and celebrate with the family the Christmas Eve Mass very humbling beautiful honorably and Sanctified praise God

name: steve
review: Very old church built in the 1800's and we replaced the old lightning protection on it from the original system used back then. True craftsman ship

name: Khina Ka‚ÄôChing
review: This is one of the most beautiful churches around.... Love going!

name: Jennifer Harrison
review: Beautiful church, wood work and the plaster trim was incredible, what a lost art!!

name: Nevada Stewart
review: Absolutely gorgeous

name: Matt Gensheimer
review: Amazing architecture

name: Michael Hydorn
review: Wonderful architecture, wonderful preaching by Dr. Camp

name: Ian Cunningham
review: Beautiful old church and the lady answering questions was awesome and very knowledgeable.

name: Jim Gardner
review: Only able to view from outside today but, it is beautiful.

name: Nicole Arbour
review: Amazing!!! Even during an intense renovation, the beauty is there.

name: Gene Helton
review: Beautiful loved it so much history must see

name: Greg McCarthy
review: Beautiful historic church with a wonderful dynamic congregation

name: Jimmie Dietz
review: This place is in st. Augustine amazing go look at it
